- Academic performance in relevant qualifying examinations (e.g., 10+2 for UG, bachelor's degree for PG)

name: Alliance University, School of Engineering and Design
accreditation: NAAC A+, NBA, AICTE, UGC, ABET
admission_process:
The admission process at Alliance University, School of Engineering and Design is entrance-based and includes the following steps:

- Academic performance in 10+2 or equivalent examination with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics (minimum 45% for General, 40% for SC/ST/OBC) for UG courses, and bachelor's degree for PG courses
- Valid entrance examination scores (JEE Main, JEE Advanced, KCET, COMEDK UGET, AUEET for B.Tech; GATE, Karnataka PGCET for M.Tech)
- Counselling for seat allocation through KEA, COMEDK, or university-based process
- Document verification and fee payment
- Management quota seats available with higher fees, requiring a valid entrance exam score
- For Ph.D. programs, candidates must clear the Alliance Research Aptitude Test (ARAT) followed by a personal interview and evaluation of research synopsis

name: B.M.S. College of Engineering
admission_process:
The admission process at B.M.S. College of Engineering is merit-based and includes the following steps:

- Academic performance in 10+2 or equivalent examination with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics (minimum 45% for General, 40% for SC/ST/OBC) for UG courses, and bachelor's degree for PG courses
- Valid entrance examination scores (KCET, COMEDK UGET, JEE Main for B.E.; GATE, Karnataka PGCET for M.Tech; KMAT, Karnataka PGCET, CAT, MAT, CMAT for MBA/MCA)
- Counselling through KEA or COMEDK for seat allocation

- Management quota seats (25%) available with higher fees, requiring at least one entrance exam (KCET, COMEDK, or JEE Main)
- For Ph.D. programs, candidates must clear the ULRAT entrance exam conducted by Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) followed by a personal interview

The admission process at PES University is merit-based and includes the following steps:

- Academic performance in 10+2 or equivalent examination with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics (minimum 50% marks) for UG courses, and bachelor's degree for PG courses
- Valid entrance examination scores (PESSAT, KCET, JEE Main for B.Tech/B.E.; PESSAT, GATE, Karnataka PGCET for M.Tech; PESSAT, CAT, MAT, CMAT, GMAT for MBA; PESSAT for other programs)
- PESSAT (PES Scholastic Aptitude Test) is mandatory for most programs, followed by counselling for seat allocation
- Document verification and fee payment
- Management quota seats available with higher fees, requiring PESSAT or other accepted entrance exam scores
- For Ph.D. programs, candidates must clear the PES University Research Entrance Test followed by an interview

name: Jain University, Faculty of Engineering and Technology
admission_process:
The admission process at Jain University, Faculty of Engineering and Technology is entrance-based and includes the following steps:

- Academic performance in 10+2 or equivalent examination with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Electronics/Computer Science/Biology (minimum 60% for General, 55% for SC/ST/OBC) for UG courses, and bachelor's degree for PG courses
- Valid entrance examination scores (Jain Entrance Test (JET), JEE Main, COMEDK UGET, Uni-GAUGE for B.Tech; GATE, Karnataka PGCET, JET for M.Tech; CAT, MAT, CMAT, JET for MBA)
- Counselling for seat allocation through university or KEA/COMEDK
- Document verification and fee payment
- Management quota seats available with higher fees, requiring a valid entrance exam score
- For Ph.D. programs, candidates must clear the Jain University Ph.D. Entrance Test or VTU ULRAT, followed by an interview

admission_process:
The admission process at Teerthanker Mahaveer University is merit-based and includes the following steps:

- Academic performance in 10+2 or equivalent examination for UG courses, and bachelor's degree for PG courses
- Valid entrance examination scores (TMU Entrance Test, NEET for medical courses, JEE Main for B.Tech)
- Counselling and document verification
- Management quota seats available with higher fees
